Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the bodies of children with their organs removed were found in Thailand.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the severity of the situation by falsely linking it to organ trafficking.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the existence of bodies of children with their organs removed in Thailand.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photo of dead children from Syria in 2013 is related to the alleged incident in Thailand.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim falsely attributes the photo from Syria to an unrelated incident in Thailand, suggesting an alternative explanation for the origin of the image.
